cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 330 miles SE of the mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to meander slowly north-northeast through Saturday, then gradually turn northwest toward the western Gulf and the Texas coast early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Central to upper Texas coast (roughly between Port O’Connor and Freeport, TX)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf of Mexico shoreline from Tampico, MX to the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts
weather_observation.wind: Up to tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph gusts) possible late Sunday into Monday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Prolonged on-shore flow could push water levels 2–4 ft above normal tides along the upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands may produce 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, creating flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High seas and dangerous rip currents; possible coastal flooding of port access roads.
